page.title: 06FARM VISITS
page.content: {STAVERTON COURT.}179hect,73past,99arab 4wood,3other,10largest. {FARMER } manager plus 5 workers, many machines. {CROPS }wheat,barley,beans,grass,154 friesians. {VALLEY FARM. }52past.{Farmer}and wife. {CROPS }24 friesians,grass, poultry. Basic machinery {MANOR FARM.}126acres 109past,17arab. 25largest.{CROPS }Wheat,barley, 168 beef steers. FARMHOUSE built 1700. 12 farms were visited and these are samples of the replies. All the farmers were asked about conservation and all agreed that it was important. There were foxes, badgers weasels, hares, rabbits, pheasants and many species of birds. Some farmers admitted that the use of their hedgers did spoil habitat but then so did the litter often dumped around the hedges by the'townies'.Farmers were not poor.
